author: Markus
content:
... and what that solidarity is worth I see here in Harare. Imagine they still have a Politburo here!

A local colleague told me that here if you go out as a (political) protester on the street you should better prepared to die. And I fear thats not hyperbole. 

Of course that does not excuse what T. has done and will do his country, his voters included. But I just read statistics that 22% of the Germans would accept a political 'Fuehrer' that doesn't bother with parliament or law. Admittedly I was shocked, but then this just reflects what manifests itself in Poland, Hungary, Great Britain, France, just to name a few.
